questions.text: In the episode "Within the Woods" which of the Turtles was injured and had to be nursed back to health?
questions.explanation:
Leonardo.

	Leo was injured in the fight with the Kraang as the Turtles were fleeing from New York City. Raph watched over Leo as he was slowly regaining his health. Mikey took to doing chores around the farm and Donnie built a lab in the barn.

questions.text: In the episode "Within the Woods", which Turtle did April beat during the sparring session?
questions.explanation:
Raph.

	In this version of the animated series, April trained as a ninja like the Turtles. With Raph slightly distracted, worrying about Leo, April was able to get the upper hand and punch him in the jaw. He landed hard on the ground. Mikey started to make fun of him for losing to her.

questions.text: Mikey enjoyed watching TV while the Turtles were on the farm. Who was the main character of his favorite show?
questions.explanation:
Crognard: The Barbarian.

	The animated "Crognard: The Barbarian" was the show within the show. It was portrayed as a simpler type of animation than the Turtles were, as if it was from a different time period. Mikey proclaimed it his favorite show during the episode "Within the Woods". The other three options were all villains the Turtles faced during the series.

questions.text: What mythological beast did the Turtles save from a hunter during the episode "A Foot Too Big"?
questions.explanation:
Bigfoot.

	The bounty hunter who called himself "The Finger" carried around a shrunken head with him and talked to it as if it were his mother. He referred to himself as the best hunter in the world. Bigfoot ended up being a female, and developed a crush on Donatello.

questions.text: What did Donnie build for April in the episode "A Foot Too Big"?
questions.explanation:
A music box.

	Donnie, who had a big crush on April, built her a music box that included a picture of himself inside it. She was less than pleased with the gift, and wasn't very good at hiding that. She thanked him, set the music box down and made an excuse to leave.

questions.text: Where was the Kraang ship found in the episode "Buried Secrets"?
questions.explanation:
Under the farm house.

	The ship was found under April's farm house while the Turtles, April and Casey cleaned. April had no idea it was buried there, though the big surprise was the contents of the ship.  Her mother was found in a stasis pod inside, or at least someone she thought was her mother.

questions.text: In "Buried Secrets" April's long-lost mother returned. What was wrong with her?
questions.correct: She was a creature in disguise.
options: She had completely lost her memory.
It was a hologram that only looked like Mrs. O'Neil.
questions.explanation:
She was a creature in disguise.

	It turned out that it wasn't her real mother. The creature had both Kraang and human DNA. April's "mother" turned out to be a shapeshifting creature that was in a stasis tube in the hidden ship under the farm house. The creature kidnapped three of the Turtles and stashed them away while trying to convince April to leave with her.

questions.text: What mutated pet did Mikey bring with him to the farmhouse in the episode "The Croaking"?
questions.explanation:
Ice Cream Kitty.

	Ice Cream Kitty was a mixture of a stray cat and some Neapolitan ice cream. Mikey decided to keep the cat as a pet after its mutation. It had no hind legs and had to be kept in the freezer or else he would melt.

questions.text: Who did Mikey meet up with in the woods during the episode "The Croaking"?
questions.explanation:
Napoleon Bonafrog.

	Napoleon Bonafrog was voiced by Jon Heder, who was made famous when he played the lead character in the movie "Napoleon Dynamite". Napoleon Bonafrog was the outcast of the mutated frogs, much like Mikey was among the four Turtles. Mikey stayed with the mutated frogs for much of the episode.

questions.text: What was not a name for one of the mutated frogs in "The Croaking"?
questions.explanation:
Mozar.

	The Punk Frogs were all named after famous world figures. The three incorrect options, along with Napoleon, made up the troupe of frogs. Mozar was the leader of a different set of villains that appeared later in the series run. The episode the frogs (in mutated form) debuted in was "The Croaking".
